item.title: Committees launch joint inquiry on Government’s Child Poverty Strategy
item.description: MPs on the Education and Work and Pensions Committees have today launched a new inquiry investigating how the Government’s new Child Poverty Strategy, announced last month, can meet its aims.

item.title: MPs endorse Emma Douglas for Pensions watchdog chair
item.description: MPs on the Work and Pensions Committee have endorsed Emma Douglas for the role of Chair of the Pensions Regulator.

item.title: MPs to question DWP officials amid complaints controversy
item.description: DWP officials will be questioned by Work and Pensions Committee MPs amid concerns raised by the Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman (PHSO) over how seriously the Department is tackling failings at the heart of the WASPI women scandal.

item.title: Committee launch new inquiry on tackling youth NEET crisis
item.description: The cross-party Work and Pensions Committee has launched a new inquiry examining the causes and impacts of young people not in employment, education or training (NEET) and measures to fix it.

item.title: ‘Broken’ careers service funding model to be reformed, Government confirms
item.description: Funding for careers advisors will be reformed, the Government has confirmed, following criticism of the current model in a report by a cross-party Committee of MPs.

item.title: Government agrees to end ‘rigid focus’ on weekly 35-hour job search rules after Committee report
item.description: The Government has signalled it will end the ‘rigid focus’ on the 35-hour a week job search requirements for out of work benefit claimants after a Work and Pensions Committee report called on it to scrap blanket benefit requirements.

item.title: Inquiry launched on pre-pension income gap support
item.description: A cross-party committee of MPs has launched an inquiry into the pre-pension income gap ahead of the impending State Pension age increase to 67.

item.title: Committee Chair flags disability poverty risk in wake of Government response
item.description: The Work and Pensions Committee has today published the Government’s response to its Get Britain Working: Pathways to work report.

item.title: MPs: Careers service reform an ‘exciting opportunity’ needing more detail
item.description: MPs on the Commons Work and Pensions Committee have praised the establishment of the new jobs and career service but called for the Government to “urgently bring forward more details” on its plans, warning that uncertainty is putting service delivery at risk.

item.title: Jobcentres shakeup needs more detail and ambition, say MPs
item.description: MPs on the Work and Pensions Committee have called on the DWP to reform the conditionality regime, including sanctions, placed on jobseekers and people in work on Universal Credit. The Committee also want to see a personalised action plan, which better reflects their skills and experience, replace the Claimant Commitment.

item.title: MPs open Child Maintenance Service inquiry
item.description: The cross-party Work and Pensions Committee has launched a new inquiry into the child maintenance payment watchdog which facilitates and enforces payments between separated parents to help pay for their child’s day-to-day care.

item.title: Concerns new UC health claimants could face poverty
item.description: A new report from the Work and Pensions Committee has raised concerns that planned cuts to the health component of Universal Credit (UC health) will push disabled people into poverty despite the above inflation rise in the UC standard allowance.

item.title: MPs call for national strategy to tackle pensioner poverty
item.description: A cross-party group of MPs has urged the Government to commit to a UK-wide, cross-government strategy for an ageing society, that will help target support to tackle pensioner poverty.

item.title: MPs launch new inquiry to address disability employment gap
item.description: The Commons Work and Pensions Committee has launched a new inquiry, Employment support for disabled people, on how to improve the job prospects of disabled people and is calling for the views of disabled people, employers, and experts.

item.title: MPs call for new legal duty for DWP to safeguard claimants
item.description: A new legal duty should be placed on the Department of Work and Pensions (DWP) to fix its “deficient” safeguarding practices following the tragic deaths of some of its customers in recent years, according to a new report by the cross-party Work and Pensions Committee.

item.title: MPs to examine boosting pension funds’ UK investment
item.description: MPs on the Work and Pensions Committee will question pension industry leaders and finance think tanks on pension funds’ UK investments and how to boost them.

item.title: How will welfare changes impact health and worklessness? Committee to take evidence
item.description: The Work and Pensions Committee will take evidence from disability campaigners, and academic and health industry experts on the impact that proposals to change incapacity and disability benefits will have on health and worklessness.

item.title: MPs to examine boosting pension funds’ UK investment
item.description: MPs on the Work and Pensions Committee will question pension industry leaders and finance think tanks on pension funds’ UK investments and how to boost them.

item.title: Health impact of pensioner poverty: MPs to take evidence from Marmot Review author
item.description: Professor Sir Michael Marmot, the author of a 2010 review that warned of rising health inequalities if relative poverty was not addressed, will give evidence to the Work and Pensions Committee as part of its Pensioner Poverty inquiry.

item.title: Government’s welfare reform proposals subject of new Committee inquiry
item.description: The cross-party Work and Pensions Committee has today launched its new inquiry on the Government’s welfare reform proposals, Pathways to Work.
